solution_line_template: First find how many ml of oil Mason adds by multiplying the volume of the bowl by the proportion filled with oil: {bowl_volume} ml * {oil_proportion} = <<{bowl_volume}*{oil_proportion}={oil_volume}>>{oil_volume} ml
Then repeat the process to find how many ml of vinegar he added: {bowl_volume} ml * {vinegar_proportion} = <<{bowl_volume}*{vinegar_proportion}={vinegar_volume}>>{vinegar_volume} ml
Now find the weight of the oil by multiplying the volume by the weight/volume ratio: {oil_volume} ml * {oil_density} g/ml = <<{oil_volume}*{oil_density}={oil_weight}>>{oil_weight} g

Do the same procedure with the weight and weight/volume ratio of the vinegar to find its weight: {vinegar_volume} ml * {vinegar_density} g/ml = <<{vinegar_volume}*{vinegar_density}={vinegar_weight}>>{vinegar_weight} g

Now add the weight of the oil and the vinegar to find the weight of the salad dressing: {oil_weight} g + {vinegar_weight} g = <<{oil_weight}+{vinegar_weight}={total_dressing_weight}>>{total_dressing_weight} g
